{
  "skills": [
    {
      "id": "skill_animal_care",
      "name": "Animal Care",
      "type": "Advanced",
      "characteristic": "Intelligence",
      "isGrouped": false,
      "specialisations": [],
      "description": "The Animal Care skill allows you to tend to the health and well-being of animals, including diagnosing and treating illnesses or injuries.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Keeping animals healthy without needing a Test (requires at least 1 Advance).",
        "Testing to spot an illness or understand the reason for an animal's distress.",
        "Determining the quality and condition of an animal.",
        "Healing an animal for a number of Wounds equal to your Intelligence Bonus + SL. (Note: An animal can only benefit from one such healing test per encounter).",
        "Staunching an animal's Bleeding Condition.",
        "Grooming and preparing an animal for show or display."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "You can use an Action to make an Animal Care Test to appraise an enemy animal. If successful, you and any allies you inform gain a +10 bonus to all tests to hit that animal (or its rider) until the end of your next turn. This bonus can only be applied once per target animal."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_animal_training",
      "name": "Animal Training",
      "type": "Advanced",
      "characteristic": "Intelligence",
      "isGrouped": true,
      "specialisations": ["Demigryph", "Dog", "Horse", "Pegasus", "Pigeon"],
      "description": "This skill represents your ability to train and command a specific type of animal. It allows you to identify the trained abilities of an animal within your specialisation and is used for the Animal Training Endeavour between adventures.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Identifying what commands or training an animal has received.",
        "Training animals during downtime (Animal Training Endeavour)."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "You can use an Action to make an Opposed Animal Training/Willpower Test against a single animal of your specialisation. If you win, the animal gains the Fear condition towards you until the end of your next turn. While an animal is affected by this Fear, you may use your Animal Training Skill instead of a Melee skill to defend against its attacks or to 'attack' it by issuing commands (e.g., commanding it to flee or stand down), subject to GM approval."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_art",
      "name": "Art",
      "type": "Basic",
      "characteristic": "Dexterity",
      "isGrouped": true,
      "specialisations": ["Cartography", "Engraving", "Mosaics", "Painting", "Sculpture", "Tattoo", "Weaving"],
      "description": "The Art skill allows you to create works of art in your chosen medium. The quality of the final piece is determined by the Success Level (SL) of your test.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Creating a piece of art. This may be an Extended Test for large or complex works.",
        "Fulfilling an artistic commission."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "The skill itself has little direct use in combat, though objects created (like a heavy sculpture) could potentially be used as improvised weapons."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_athletics",
      "name": "Athletics",
      "type": "Basic",
      "characteristic": "Agility",
      "isGrouped": false,
      "specialisations": [],
      "description": "This skill governs your general physical prowess, including your ability to run, jump, and perform other acts of speed, grace, and physical exertion.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Running and Chasing (see Pursuit rules).",
        "Leaping and Falling.",
        "General feats of physical activity not covered by other skills."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "Athletics is the core skill used to determine movement capabilities and resolve actions related to moving across difficult terrain or performing acrobatic maneuvers during a fight."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_bribery",
      "name": "Bribery",
      "type": "Basic",
      "characteristic": "Fellowship",
      "isGrouped": false,
      "specialisations": [],
      "description": "Your ability to effectively offer and negotiate a bribe, and to judge whether a target is susceptible to one.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Make a Bribery Test to determine if a target is open to being bribed.",
        "If successful, the GM secretly determines the price. You get a number of guesses equal to 1 + SL to ask if the price is 'higher' or 'lower' than an amount you state.",
        "After your guesses, you make your final offer."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "You can attempt to bribe an opponent to stop a fight. This is a Hard (â€“20) Bribery Test and is subject to the situation (e.g., the opponent must be able to understand you and be willing to negotiate)."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_channelling",
      "name": "Channelling",
      "type": "Advanced",
      "characteristic": "Willpower",
      "isGrouped": true,
      "specialisations": ["Aqshy (Fire)", "Azyr (Heavens)", "Chamon (Metal)", "Dhar (Dark)", "Ghur (Beasts)", "Ghyran (Life)", "Hysh (Light)", "Shyish (Death)", "Ulgu (Shadow)"],
      "description": "Channelling is the skill used to draw upon and control the Winds of Magic. Its use is governed entirely by the rules presented in the Magic chapter. It can be used untrained (ungrouped) by those not properly initiated, often with dangerous consequences.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Gathering magical energy for a spell via an Extended Channelling Test."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "Used to prepare spells for casting, making it a foundational skill for any spellcaster in combat."
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_charm",
      "name": "Charm",
      "type": "Basic",
      "characteristic": "Fellowship",
      "isGrouped": false,
      "specialisations": [],
      "description": "The ability to make others view you, your opinions, and your actions in a favorable light through flattery, wit, and pleasantries.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Make an Opposed Charm/Cool Test to influence targets. The number of people you can affect is equal to your Fellowship Bonus + SL."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "As an Action, you can make a Charm Test to persuade affected targets not to attack you for that round. As a defensive reaction, you can use Charm against a single attacker. Winning a Charm test in combat grants you +1 Advantage. Once you fail a Charm test against a target, you cannot attempt to Charm them again during that encounter.",
      "specialUses": [
        {
          "useCase": "Public Speaking",
          "description": "A specific application of the Charm skill used to sway large groups or crowds with impressive speeches. Make a Charm Test to influence a number of targets equal to your Fellowship Bonus + SL. If the crowd is unruly, the test becomes Opposed by the crowd's average Willpower. An Astounding Failure can turn the crowd hostile."
        },
        {
          "useCase": "Begging",
          "description": "A specific application of the Charm skill used to scrounge for money. Make a Charm Test, with difficulty modified by location and appearance. Success earns a number of brass pennies equal to your Fellowship Bonus x SL per hour. An Astounding Failure attracts negative attention."
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "skill_charm_animal",
      "name": "Charm Animal",
      "type": "Basic",
      "characteristic": "Willpower",
      "isGrouped": false,
      "specialisations": [],
      "description": "Your aptitude for quickly befriending, calming, or asserting dominance over animals.",
      "commonUses": [
        "Make a Charm Animal Test to influence the behavior of one or more animals, up to a maximum of Willpower Bonus + SL.",
        "The test is typically Opposed by the animal's Willpower unless it is already docile."
      ],
      "combatApplication": "When facing animals, a successful Charm Animal Test will prevent the affected targets from attacking you for that round and grants you +1 Advantage. This can be repeated, but once you fail, you lose your influence."
    },
    {

      "characteristic": "Strength",

      "commonUses": [

    },
    {

    {
